review.title: “Meaningful work in a place where both results and relationships are important.”
review.pros: Pros – Great opportunity to work across businesses, changing functions, and building networks and a diverse work experience. Culture of respect and collaboration.
review.cons: Cons – Things don't always move fast; compensation is average.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great company”
review.pros: Pros – Good growth opportunity for all!
review.cons: Cons – they are no cons to this company

review.title: “Square D”
review.pros: Pros – Professional mangement with integrity. Opportunity to move up within the company as they typically promote from within the organization. Good feedback and support from managment.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes the course of action by managment is too conservative without consideration of creative means of accomplishing the end result.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The advice would consist of gaining momentum within the organization to think "out of the box" at times. Not necessarily a wholesale change in style, but lettting in a little outside influence.

review.title: “Assembly Technician”
review.pros: Pros – The best thing about Square D was the amount of pay versus the amount of work required.
review.cons: Cons – Too much indifference to personnel.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look @ the little people before making major decisions

review.title: “Overview of working at Square D”
review.pros: Pros – Great products, industry leader. Big company worldwide. People with great knowledge. Some handicaps in the empowerment of people. Good working environment.
review.cons: Cons – It is hard sometimes to get recognized due to the lot of people that works there. Must work on an appropiate balance scorecard
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Promote your people. Give them more empowerment. Strategy of the company should be well know by all of their employees.

review.title: “Square D is a good place”
review.pros: Pros – Good Training and has good locations. Most Manager's are progressive.
review.cons: Cons – Didn't consider the family implications when requiring relocations
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You used to be more compassionate to employees about their family issues. The french connection eroded that.

review.title: “SQD/Schneider Electric was a solid employer”
review.pros: Pros – Supportive manager, and solid benefits. Great exposure to a wide breadth of people and products. Lots of directions to take with one's career.
review.cons: Cons – Heavily matrixed organization with an identity complex. Numerous divisions of Schneider Electric are functioning independently and without synergies. Poor onboarding experience.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I enjoyed my time at Square D and hear many concerns over the recent RIFs. Don't cut it too far back or SQD will become one of the undesireable places to work. Provide opportunities for cross-functional advancement.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – They promote within the company
review.cons: Cons – They need to focus on employee morale. They recently went through many layoffs that effected the performance of existing employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – When you execute layoffs, you need to improve morale.
